thread.title: Kingdom stars Matt Lauria and Nick Jonas get competitive off and on screen
thread.title_full: Kingdom stars Matt Lauria and Nick Jonas get competitive off and on screen

title: Kingdom stars Matt Lauria and Nick Jonas get competitive off and on screen
text:
Kingdom stars Matt Lauria and Nick Jonas get competitive off and on screen Kingdom stars Matt Lauria and Nick Jonas get competitive off and on screen 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Matt Lauria has admitted he can’t help but compete with co-star Nick Jonas when training for their mixed-martial arts drama Kingdom. 
The pair star as fighters in the show and train for hours every day to get their bodies in fighting shape. 
Matt, who is best known for his role as a football star in Friday Night Lights, said playing a fighter is far more physically demanding. 
Speaking on the red carpet at the celebration of the show at the Paley Center for Media in Beverly Hills, following the premiere of the second season on America’s DireTV, Matt said: “I played an athlete on Friday Night Lights but we were padded and had helmets on and had talented doubles. 
“I never really played football, I didn’t know how to hit people, I could really injure myself or someone else. If you’re just wearing a pair of shorts, it’s hard to fake. We carefully choreograph the fights but you have to have the physical vocabulary, if you can’t throw jabs… 
“I’m not saying we are fantastic but we are really trying. Every free minute we get we are doing training, boxing or jiu jitsu, it’s constant.” 
Matt added that the competition between the members of the cast spurs them on. The cast of Kingdom – Frank Grillo, Mark Consuelos, Matt Lauria, Joanna Going, Jonathan Tucker and Nick Jonas (Nina Prommer/AP) 
He continued: “It’s a really healthy way, everyone commits so intensely, not just when they are approaching the psychology but also in the physicality. We drive each other, there is a real ethic among the ranks. 
“Our first season motto was ‘all in, all the time’, the second season was ‘unreasonable commitment’. You can’t ever let up because the minute you do, you see one of your beautiful co-workers sprinting past you.” Share article 
Kingdom has returned for a second series on US screens. Promoted Stories
